alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 5:46AM EDT until July 11 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 546 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area through 700 am. Flash flooding has been reported in the City of Barre within the past hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Barre City, Barre Town, E F Knapp State Airport, Websterville, East Montpelier, Berlin, Plainfield, Orange, South Barre, Lower Websterville, Graniteville, Upper Graniteville and East Barre. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
